metadata.title: CVE-2019-18348 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.17 and urllibin Python 3.x through 3.8.0. CRLF injection is possible if the attackercontrols a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument tourllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the host component of aURL) followed by an HTTP header. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 querystring issue and the CVE-2019-9947 path string issue. (This is notexploitable when glibc has CVE-2016-10739 fixed.). This is fixed in:v2.7.18, v2.7.18rc1; v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1; v3.6.11, v3.6.11rc1, v3.6.12;v3.7.8, v3.7.8rc1, v3.7.9; v3.8.3, v3.8.3rc1, v3.8.4, v3.8.4rc1, v3.8.5,v3.8.6, v3.8.6rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11
No subscription required

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.11').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.10').
